description: A vegan diet is made up of plant-based foods, such as fruits, vegetables, beans, grains, nuts, and seeds, and excludes all animal products and by-products. This includes dairy, eggs, honey, meat, poultry, and seafood.

A vegetarian diet consists of foods that mainly come from plants, such as vegetables, fruits, whole grains, legumes, seeds, and nuts. Some vegetarians also include eggs and/or milk if they are lacto-ovo vegetarian.
A gluten-free diet excludes foods that contain gluten, a protein found in wheat and other grains.

A dairy-free diet can include plant-based milk alternatives, yogurt, tofu, and other dairy-free foods. When choosing dairy-free products, you can look for those that are fortified with calcium, vitamin D, and protein.
